articles.title: 3 dead, 3 injured after shooting at R.I. high school hockey game, mayor calls shooting ‘targeted family dispute’
articles.description:
“A North Smithfield father is one of the heroes of the afternoon. ... he grabbed a gun out of the (shooter's) hand, but the individual had a second weapon.”

The post 3 dead, 3 injured after shooting at R.I. high school hockey game, mayor calls shooting ‘targeted family dispute’ appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Three people died and three were injured at a Rhode Island high school hockey game.
Mayor described the incident as a targeted family dispute, raising safety concerns for local events.
Boston residents may face increased security measures at future sporting events following this tragedy.

articles.title: Jaylen Brown calls out city of Beverly Hills for shutting down his All-Star Weekend event
articles.description:
"They didn’t try to have a conversation and they shut everything down. So the statement they put out there was completely false."

The post Jaylen Brown calls out city of Beverly Hills for shutting down his All-Star Weekend event appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Jaylen Brown's All-Star Weekend event was abruptly shut down by Beverly Hills officials.
Brown criticized the city's lack of communication regarding the event cancellation.
The incident highlights challenges for Boston athletes hosting events outside their home city.

articles.title: Obama shuts down alien buzz and says there’s no evidence they’ve made contact
articles.description:
"I saw no evidence during my presidency that extraterrestrials have made contact with us. Really!”

The post Obama shuts down alien buzz and says there’s no evidence they’ve made contact appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Obama stated no evidence of extraterrestrial contact during his presidency.
His comments come amid rising public interest in UFO sightings.
Boston residents may feel reassured about ongoing government transparency on UFOs.

articles.title: Yes, George Washington led the Siege of Boston. No, he didn’t have wooden teeth.
articles.description:
Washington never wore wooden dentures, instead using those with ivory, gold, and even human teeth.

The post Yes, George Washington led the Siege of Boston. No, he didn’t have wooden teeth. appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: George Washington led the Siege of Boston during the American Revolution in 1775.
Washington's dentures were made from ivory, gold, and human teeth, not wood.
This historical clarification enhances Boston's rich narrative about its revolutionary past.

articles.title: Nancy Guthrie kidnapping investigators work with Walmart after identifying suspect’s backpack
articles.description:
Pima Count Sheriff Chris Nanos said in a text message to The Associated Press on Monday that the 25-liter “Ozark Trail Hiker Pack” backpack was the only clothing item that has been “definitively identified.”

The post Nancy Guthrie kidnapping investigators work with Walmart after identifying suspect’s backpack appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Investigators identified a suspect's 25-liter Ozark Trail backpack linked to Nancy Guthrie's kidnapping.
Pima County Sheriff Chris Nanos confirmed the backpack's identification on February 16, 2026.
Walmart is collaborating with authorities to aid in the investigation's progress.

articles.title: Robert Duvall, Oscar-winning actor and ‘Godfather’ mainstay, dead at 95
articles.description:
Duvall died “peacefully” at his home Sunday in Middleburg, Virginia, according to an announcement from his publicist and from a statement posted on his Facebook page by his wife, Luciana Duvall.

The post Robert Duvall, Oscar-winning actor and ‘Godfather’ mainstay, dead at 95 appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Oscar-winning actor Robert Duvall passed away at 95 on February 16, 2026.
Duvall was known for his iconic role in 'The Godfather' and other films.
His death may prompt local tributes and discussions about his influence on cinema.
